perturbation.original_text: "Nuance Data" means any Data that is (i) owned by a Third Party and licensed to the Nuance Group as of immediately prior to the Distribution pursuant to a Nuance Data Agreement or (ii) owned by the Nuance Group as of immediately prior to the Distribution but subject to a Nuance Data Agreement, in each case (i) and (ii), which Data is used in the SpinCo Business as of immediately prior to the Distribution.
perturbation.changed_text: "Nuance Data" means any Data used by Nuance.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition precisely delineates the types of data considered 'Nuance Data,' referencing specific licensing agreements and business usage. The modified definition omits these specifics, creating ambiguity. Later sections of the contract might rely on the original definition to determine obligations regarding this data, leading to inconsistencies in enforcement if only this modified definition is present.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.01. License Grants.

(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive, fully paid-up, perpetual and irrevocable, transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII), sublicensable (subject to Section 3.01(g)) license under the Nuance Patents, solely to the extent that claims of the Nuance Patents cover products or services of the SpinCo Business in the SpinCo Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof, in each case to make, have made, use, sell, offer for sale, import and otherwise exploit such products and services, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.01. License Grants.

(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive license under the Nuance Patents to make, have made, use products and services.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the license as 'fully paid-up, perpetual and irrevocable, transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII), sublicensable (subject to Section 3.01(g))' and restricts its scope to products/services of the SpinCo Business within the SpinCo Field of Use. The modification removes these critical limitations, potentially implying the license is not fully paid, not perpetual, not transferable, not sublicensable and extends beyond the intended field of use. This directly contradicts the intentions outlined in the recitals and other sections, creating uncertainty about the license's extent and conditions.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE VII LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND WARRANTY DISCLAIMER

Section 7.01. Limitation on Liability. Without limiting the terms set forth in Section 6.09 of the Separation Agreement, none of Nuance, SpinCo or any other member of either Group shall in any event have any Liability to the other or to any other member of the other's Group under this Agreement for any indirect, special, punitive or consequential damages, whether or not caused by or resulting from negligence or breach of obligations hereunder and whether or not informed of the possibility of the existence of such damages.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE VII LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND WARRANTY DISCLAIMER

Section 7.01. Limitation on Liability. None of Nuance, SpinCo or any other member of either Group shall in any event have any Liability to the other or to any other member of the other's Group under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the qualification relating to 'indirect, special, punitive or consequential damages,' the modified text implies a complete exclusion of all liability, regardless of the type of damage. This contradicts the rest of the agreement, which outlines specific obligations and remedies, implicitly accepting that liability could arise. The original section acknowledges specific limitations mentioned in Section 6.09 of the Separation Agreement, but the modified text eliminates this reference. This omission contradicts the potential conditions or exemptions detailed in the referenced section, causing inconsistencies.
